name: COMO Shambhala Estate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We very carefully selected this hotel after previously staying at one of their sister resorts - Cocoa Island in the Maldives (paradise!).
reviews.title: Enchanting!

likes.liked: — Everything - clean, stunning view from balcony and surprisingly no bugs!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The initial walk to our room provided us with our first stunning glance of the sheer drop of rainforest and I literally welled up. The continuing beauty of the whole resort is amazing, you feel as though you have been placed in the most enchanted forest - totally yours to discover...
reviews.title: One of a kind experience

reviews.text: The food is of a high quality and like the whole estate - geared towards health - although they do cater well to requests. If you are interested in alternative therapies, nature, well-being and spa treatments then this is the place for you - totally immerse yourself and enjoy!
reviews.title: what a stunner...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The walk back up from the river can be exhausting, however this didn't stop us walking down there every day and I did feel incredibly fit when I left!
reviews.title: Very Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took so many books to read however brought them all back unread as I couldn't tear myself away from just staring at the views and soaking up the whole atmosphere of the place.
reviews.title: Blissful but some traps

reviews.text: The plan was 3 nights pure endulgance and total relaxation and stress management.
reviews.title: Away from it all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I visited Como 2 years ago and was so enchanted by this place that I instantly had dreams of a wedding here. Not that I had a fiance, or even a date for that matter, but IF I were to get married SOMEDAY, by golly it would be here.
reviews.title: Epic Wedding, Eternal Memories

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fast forward 2 years. I return with a willing man in tow, and I find myself floating above acres of perfectly manicured hibiscus plants, flawless palm trees, and bursting fern. Up and down the many pathways, each leading to an even more ridiculously breathtaking view of endless green, or some tasteful architectural wonder. What you don't see are the hundreds of people-in-waiting, anticipating your thirst or hunger or whim. "Gee, it's warm", et voila...ice water and a cold towel so intoxicating you nearly wet your pants. Speaking of intoxicating...we usually take a nice glass of wine at dinner. With the quality and flavors of the spa and raw menus and local cuisine, we were drunk with the food itself. It's as if someone hand-picked everything we ate from the Garden of Eden. We so swear by the magical effects of the pressed juices, that we threw down for a $400 juicer back home to recreate that incredible, 'My-God-I-Have-A-Whole-New-Colon' feeling.
reviews.title: Body, Mind and Spirit

reviews.text: Back to the wedding....it leaves me speechless thinking of it. Imagine 9 balinese girls cascading before me down ancient stone steps, amidst frangipani blossoms and fragrant pandan, surrounded by pools of holy water and a verdant, living backdrop. Gamelan pinging mingles with the rush of waterfalls. A ten minute ceremony consummates my union with my soulmate. Como attended to all my whims in the most tasteful and stylish manner. Effortless. Perfection. Martha Stewart would quit her job knowing that THIS place blows anything she's ever done away....
reviews.title: The place to give you back your sanity

likes.disliked: — the road to get into the estate was horrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My new husband and I then stayed at the Bulgari, and were thoroughly disgusted by obscene prices and paltry customer service that paled in comparison to Como's. Where else can you have your Personal Assistant carry your 70 lb. luggage ON HIS HEAD, have food that is as good going in as it going out, and have a legion of camouflaged men cut acres of grassy lawn WITH A HAND SICKLE??! Como Shambhala...you won't regret a single dime at this place. And you get to leave with a priceless sensation of undoing all the bad things we do to ourselves...at last...at peace. If the gods live in Bali, then little magic fairies live at Como.
reviews.title: Sublime blend of luxury and "wellness."

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I absolutely loved this estate! We stayed in the forest and mist theme, wanakasa. Every resident has their own theme and the Wanakasa best one by far. The rooms were amazing, clean, pretty, great view, great privacy. The infinity pools were beautiful and peaceful. The walk down to the river is well worth it, there is also another pool midway down to the river. The estate is extremely well maintained. Service is great but if you call them to bring something to the room, might take over 20 min bc all residents are so far apart. The restos all organic and GLOW is a vegan resto. Breakfast is the best I've ever had, very healthy, coconut crepes and almond milk porridge. Oh so good.
reviews.title: Fairy-Tale Beauty, But A Bit Noisy

description: COMO Shambhala Estate is a residential health retreat with luxury villa-style accommodations near Ubud, Bali. This ‘Retreat for Change’ is a place to relax and improve wellbeing. State-of-the-art wellness facilities include a Vitality pool, private treatment areas beside the River Ayung, a climbing wall, gym, Pilates studio and yoga pavilion. The Estate’s Resident Experts, who all support the 360-degree approach to wellness, include a Yoga Master, Ayurvedic Doctor and guides for outdoor activities, with nutritional menus by COMO Shambhala Cuisine. The range of suites and villas, perched above the Balinese jungle, suits independent guests, couples, or small groups.
